intro: Dorstenia setosa, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming during the wet season. Dorstenia setosa is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its unique morphology and adaptability to humid environments make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
